meanings.definition: To remove the limber or limbers from (a gun).
meanings.sent1: The soldiers had to unlimber the cannon before they could fire it.
meanings.sent2: Before the battle, the artillery crew needed to unlimber the guns for combat.
meanings.sent3: The gun refused to work until they unlimbered it, causing much frustration.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, he unlimbered the weapon, ready to defend his comrades.
meanings.sent5: The process of unlimbering the gun was crucial for the success of the military operation.

meanings.definition: To prepare for action or use; make ready.
meanings.sent1: The chef needed to unlimber his knives before starting to cook.
meanings.sent2: She always made sure to unlimber her tools before beginning any project.
meanings.sent3: The students had to unlimber their pencils before the test began.
meanings.sent4: He unlimbered his camera, eager to capture the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The athlete unlimbered his muscles before the race, getting ready for the competition.
